Title: Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
About C Teleport

C Teleport is a fast-growing business travel technology company headquartered in Rotterdam, with a dynamic and international team of around 90 professionals globally. We deliver cutting-edge products that streamline high-volume travel management processes for businesses worldwide. Our B2B solutions leverage in-house technological expertise to help clients optimize their travel operations and deliver exceptional experiences to travelers, saving time and resources across the board.

At C Teleport, we believe in fostering a collaborative environment where creativity and ideas can thrive. Join us in our mission to create exceptional products that make a difference.

The Role

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Data Analyst who will be responsible for managing the full data flow necessary to provide actionable insights that support business objectives. You'll play a crucial role in transforming raw data into strategic intelligence that drives decision-making across our organization and empowers our clients.

In this position, you'll work with two main consumer groups: internal decision-makers including product managers, product designers, and department heads, as well as external customers who rely on insights to support their decision-making based on historical and forecasted performance.

Location requirement: For optimal collaboration and real-time communication with our core team, we’re only considering candidates currently based within approximately ±3 hours of the Rotterdam time zone.

What You'll Do

Data Infrastructure & Pipeline Management


Build and maintain robust data pipelines, connecting all relevant data sources from sales, marketing, product, and finance
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reporting solutions
Continuously improve and optimize reporting processes and tools



Analysis & Insights


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting requirements and business objectives
Analyze data sources and identify key metrics and performance indicators
Conduct comprehensive data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support strategic decision-making
Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for various audiences



Reporting & Visualization


Design and develop comprehensive reporting solutions, including interactive dashboards, visualizations, and detailed reports
Create compelling data stories that effectively communicate findings to stakeholders
Provide training and support to users on how to utilize reporting tools and interpret data



Continuous Learning


Stay updated on industry trends and best practices related to data analysis and reporting
Identify opportunities to enhance our data capabilities and recommend new tools or methodologies



What We're Looking For

Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably with a focus on reporting and data analysis
Strong understanding of data analysis and reporting methodologies



Technical Skills


Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python)
Expert-level skills in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, QuickSight)
Proficiency in maintaining data pipelines using tools such as Airflow
Experience with AWS data-related tools is a plus
Experience with product metrics tooling like Amplitude is a plus



Soft Skills


Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a cross-functional team
Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to data accuracy and quality



Bonus Points


Experience with business travel platforms
Knowledge of the travel technology industry



What We Offer

Join our international team remotely and be part of a company that's revolutionizing business travel technology. You'll work in a collaborative environment where your insights will directly impact business strategy and client success.

Ready to turn data into actionable intelligence that drives business growth? We'd love to hear from you.

C Teleport is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where all team members can thrive.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Rotterdam – ALTEN Netherlands




The Position




As part of our continued growth, we are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Diagnostics Data Analytics team and contribute to ongoing client projects in Rotterdam.




As a Data Analyst, your main tasks will include:




Analyzing complex diagnostic datasets to extract actionable insights supporting decision-making in healthcare environments
Developing and maintaining data pipelines, ensuring robust and automated workflows using software development best practices
Working with time-series and sensor data using InfluxDB, including crafting queries with Flux and SQL
Designing and implementing data models and applying advanced analytics techniques using Python (Pandas, NumPy, and Object-Oriented Programming)
Collaborating on dashboard creation and visualization, preferably with Grafana or similar tools, to effectively communicate findings
Engaging with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders to translate diagnostic challenges into data-driven solutions
Supporting ongoing innovation and digital transformation initiatives within the diagnostics domain




Your Profile




Minimum 3 years of professional experience in data analytics or data science, ideally with exposure to software development practices
Proficient in Python programming, including Pandas, NumPy, and Object-Oriented Programming
Experience with InfluxDB and Flux query language; working knowledge of SQL is required
Familiarity with Grafana or other dashboarding/visualization tools is a plus
Fluent in English; Dutch language skills are also preferred
Strong analytical mindset with a passion for solving real-world diagnostic data challenges
Willingness to work hybrid with 2 days per week in the Rotterdam office




Working Conditions




You get a permanent contract
You receive a competitive salary and benefits package
Hybrid working model: 2 days in-office in Rotterdam
Collaborative, innovative, and supportive work environment
Opportunities to learn and grow within a leading consultancy specializing in diagnostics and data science




Why Join Us?




Exciting Projects Across Key Industries: Contribute to impactful initiatives in healthcare, telecom, transport, defence, and finance
A Broad Range of Clients: Work with a wide spectrum of organizations—from industry leaders to innovative startups
Focus on Career Development: Enhance your expertise with continuous training, expert mentoring, and hands-on project experience
A Culture of Innovation & Teamwork: Be part of a forward-thinking team that thrives on knowledge-sharing and collaborative success




About ALTEN




ALTEN is a global leader in engineering and technology consulting, supporting top-tier clients in their innovation and R&D strategies. With over 57,000 employees in more than 30 countries, we operate across diverse sectors such as aerospace, automotive, telecom, finance, energy, and life sciences.




ALTEN Netherlands is a key entity within the ALTEN Group, with offices in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel, Apeldoorn, Groningen, and Amstelveen. Our 550+ consultants deliver high-value solutions in Technology and IT. For over 20 years in the Netherlands, we have contributed to impactful projects in high-tech, defence, transport, telecom, and finance, supporting companies in their technological transformation.




Ready for your next challenge?

Apply now and take part in exciting, high-impact projects at ALTEN Netherlands!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst at EQOM




Requirements

Over 4 years of experience
In a commercial, fast-paced organization
Solid knowledge of SQL and experience with dbt, Databricks, Power BI, and Python
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Located in the Netherlands




EQOM Group is a major force in Europe’s sexual wellness industry. As the company continues to professionalize and grow, data plays an increasingly vital role. The Data Analyst helps unlock the full potential of data, translating it into actionable insights and practical solutions to create value and support the shift towards a more data-driven way of working.




About EQOM Group

In the fast-paced and competitive world of sexual wellness, EQOM Group stands out as one of Europe’s most prominent and rapidly expanding names. Its portfolio includes a range of well-known consumer brands such as EasyToys, Christine le Duc, Amorelie, Kondomeriet, and Beate Uhse. The group was formed in 2020 through the merger of EDC Retail – a European market leader known for EasyToys – and wholesale distributor Eropartner. Backed by private equity firm Waterland, EQOM accelerated its growth by acquiring Christine le Duc in the Netherlands, Kondomeriet and Nytelse in Norway, and Amorelie in Germany.




In subsequent years, the group further expanded its footprint across Europe. Today, EQOM serves customers in more than sixty countries. While the majority of sales take place online, several retail chains – such as Kruidvat, Etos, and Hema in the Netherlands – have also started to offer EQOM products.




Mission: become the market leader

At present, EQOM employs 360 people and generates approximately 160 million euros in annual revenue. The group is embarking on a new phase centered on further professionalization and operational alignment, guided by a clear ambition: to establish itself as the market leader in the sexual wellness industry.




Vacancy: Data Analyst

Recognizing the vital role data plays in the company’s success, EQOM Group is strengthening its Data Team with several data analysts who combine technical expertise, business understanding, and interpersonal skills. This team serves as a center of excellence for data professionals, driving high-quality analysis and insights. The Data Analyst contributes by developing data models, creating visualizations with PowerBI, uncovering meaningful insights, and delivering practical solutions that improve decision-making across departments including e-commerce, logistics, finance, sales, and purchasing – serving both B2B and B2C operations.




However, real impact arises from understanding what the business truly needs. The Data Analyst should apply interpersonal skills to listen carefully, interpret insights, and challenge colleagues to explore new perspectives on how data can generate value beyond traditional dashboards.

Reporting to the Head of Data, the Data Analyst works with tools such as Databricks, Power BI, and dbt to build data pipelines, model data, and generate analytical insights. The immediate focus lies on strengthening the current setup to make it more effective and robust. At the same time, ongoing improvements in how EQOM Group supports its customers lead to new data streams and formats that will need to be integrated moving forward.




“EQOM’s data maturity is still evolving – making this the perfect moment to join. Every contribution is immediately visible and makes a tangible difference. For a data expert who thrives on building, connecting, and solving, this role offers the chance to help a company take huge steps forward.” – Ronald van den Berg, CFO




The ideal candidate is a curious and motivated professional who knows how to ask the right questions, even when problems are not yet clearly defined. Seniority is measured less by years of experience, but more by a demonstrated track record of using data effectively to create value and drive business growth. Equally important is the ability to build strong relationships with colleagues and earn their trust, both in the role and in the power of data. To foster these connections, spending time on-site in Veendam – ideally at least once every two weeks – is an essential part of the role.




Interested?

EQOM Group is working with Top of Minds to fill this vacancy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Iron EagleX (IEX), a wholly owned subsidiary of General Dynamics Information Technology, delivers agile IT and Intelligence solutions. Combining small-team flexibility with global scale, IEX leverages emerging technologies to provide innovative, user-focused solutions that empower organizations and end users to operate smarter, faster, and more securely in dynamic environments.

Responsibilities

Job Description:

The Data Analyst will use technology to mine complex, voluminous, and different varieties of data from various sources and platforms, to collect, analyze, and compile data to meet customer needs at Kelley Barracks, Möhringen, Germany.

Job Duties Include (but not limited to):


Analyze local, national, and global trends to identify new sources of data and methods to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting.
Determine technical issues and remove corrupted data & fix coding errors and related.
Work collaboratively with Intelligence and Data analysis teams to produce qualitative and quantitative data analysis that supports Intelligence products and processes.
Build data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks and/or automation for data consumers to monitor, extract, and report on data.
Work with IDST members and USSOCOM leadership to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data management strategies for the enterprise to improve the quality and usability of data.
Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data.


Qualifications

Required Skills & Experience:


Can write in Python.
Can read and understand other coding languages; HTML/CSS, R, Java, C, C++, C#
Create respective process documentation using a web-based version control.
Experience with Gitlab and Jira
Provide written and verbal communication and respective business process.
Work independently and on teams and have excellent time management and work prioritization skills.
Execute complex projects within government defined timelines across a geographically dispersed workforce and user base.
Experience providing services similar in required tasks, scope, and complexity.
MUST BE A U.S. CITIZEN


Desired Skills:


JavaScript, R, C/C++, SQL, Go, Flask, React, SQL Alchemy, CI/CD
Experience with Flask and React preferred.


Education & Certifications:


Bachelor's degree in a Computer Science discipline or equivalent.


Security Clearance:


TS with Active SCI Eligibility is REQUIRED.


Benefits:


National Health, vision, and dental plans
20 days of PTO and 11 paid holidays
Life Insurance
Short – and long-term disability plans
401(K) retirement plans
Incentive and recognition programs
Relocation opportunities


Equal Opportunity Employer / Individuals with Disabilities / Protected Veterans

In dieser Position bist Du verantwortlich für die Planung und Durchführung des gesamten Data & Analytics-Rollouts im Kundenprojekt, einschließlich Design, Implementierung, Test, Betrieb, Wartung und kontinuierlicher Verbesserung innovativer BI-Anwendungen. Du nutzt eine data & analytics best practice Lösung der HSO für die Anbindung von d365 finance & operations (ERP) sowie selbst entwickelte automatisierte ETL-Prozesse, analytische Datenmodelle, Berichte und Dashboards

Tools@HSO: Microsoft Fabric, SQL Management Studio, Visual Studio, Synapse Link, Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory, Data Models, Databases/-lakes, Power BI, DAX, Power Query M, CoPilot, Azure Foundry, D365

Gutes Verständnis für Datenanalysen und deren Visualisierung mit Power BI und anderen Reporting Lösungen
Gute Kenntnisse in der Abfragesprache SQL und dem Aufbau von relationalen Datenbanken
Gute Kenntnisse der Azure Modern Data Platform (Azure Synapse, Data Factory, DataBricks) und in der Microsoft Fabric

Ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten in der deutschen Sprache (mindestes C1), um Kunden zu beraten und zu schulen

Wir nutzen das gesamte Potenzial der Microsoft Cloud, um die Arbeitswelt unserer Kunden zu transformieren und die Unternehmensleistung zu optimieren. Mit weltweit +2500 Mitarbeitern unterstützen wir Unternehmen bei der Modernisierung von Geschäftsabläufen. HSO ist seit über 20 Jahren Mitglied im Microsoft Inner Circle - eine exklusive Gemeinschaft, in die weltweit nur die Top 1% aller Microsoft-Partner aufgenommen werden. Zahlreiche Partner of the Year Awards von Microsoft sind der Beweis für unsere ausgezeichnete Microsoft- und Branchen-Expertise. Join the journey!

  • Du tauchst tief in die Geschäftsprozesse und Methoden unserer Kunden ein, erkennst die fachlichen Anforderungen und überführst diese in aussagekräftige Data- & Analytics-Lösungen auf Basis der Microsoft Fabric oder Microsoft Azure Technologien sowie Microsoft Power BI
  • In dieser Position bist Du verantwortlich für die Planung und Durchführung des gesamten Data & Analytics-Rollouts im Kundenprojekt, einschließlich Design, Implementierung, Test, Betrieb, Wartung und kontinuierlicher Verbesserung innovativer BI-Anwendungen. Zudem unterstützt Du unsere Kunden technisch und fachlich bei Data & Analytics-Projekten, von der Anforderungsanalyse über Konzeption und Design, Datenmodellierung bis hin zur Realisierung und dem Reportdesign
  • Du nutzt eine data & analytics best practice Lösung der HSO für die Anbindung von d365 finance & operations (ERP) sowie selbst entwickelte automatisierte ETL-Prozesse, analytische Datenmodelle, Berichte und Dashboards
  • Du bist für die Weiterentwicklung oder Aufbau eines datalakes oder onelakes als Data Warehouse-Lösung zuständig sowie für die Anbindung diverser Datenquellen
  • Tools@HSO: Microsoft Fabric, SQL Management Studio, Visual Studio, Synapse Link, Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory, Data Models, Databases/-lakes, Power BI, DAX, Power Query M, CoPilot, Azure Foundry, D365
  • Du bringst die Leidenschaft für deine kontinuierliche Weiterbildung und -entwicklung im Thema Data & Analytics mit und bleibst mit dem Team immer am Puls der Zeit


Requirements

  • Ein abgeschlossenes Studium in einem MINT-Studiengang oder ein vergleichbarer Berufsabschluss mit relevanter Erfahrung (Quereinsteiger mit relevanter Berufserfahrung willkommen)
  • Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics, Microsoft Fabric, im Azure Stack, insbesondere die relevanten Tools für data & analytics sowie ein Verständnis für Datenmodelle und Datenbanken
  • Erfahrung im Umgang mit Data-Integration-Tools und Konzeptionierung von ETL-Prozessen sowie im Aufbau von Semantik-Modellen
  • Kenntnisse in relationaler und multidimensionaler Datenmodellierung
  • Gutes Verständnis für Datenanalysen und deren Visualisierung mit Power BI und anderen Reporting Lösungen
  • Gute Kenntnisse in der Abfragesprache SQL und dem Aufbau von relationalen Datenbanken
  • Gute Kenntnisse der Azure Modern Data Platform (Azure Synapse, Data Factory, DataBricks) und in der Microsoft Fabric
  • Wissen über die Power-Platform (Power-Apps, Power-Automate, DataVerse) wäre wünschenswert
  • Ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten in der deutschen Sprache (mindestes C1), um Kunden zu beraten und zu schulen


Benefits

  • Result Orientation: Du arbeitest bei einem der global größten und erfolgreichsten Microsoft-Partner im Bereich Microsoft Dynamics 365 und treibst damit die digitale Transformation voran
  • Self Determination: Bei uns steht die Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe im Mittelpunkt -mit deinen Ideen und Erfahrungen kannst du dich bei uns einbringen, eigenständig agieren und damit den Unternehmenserfolg aktiv mitgestalten
  • Team Spirit: Da Menschen bei HSO den Unterschied machen, kannst du dich auf eine unterstützende, vertrauensvolle und wertschätzende Arbeitsatmosphäre freuen
  • Learning & Growth: Wir werden dich mit Trainingsangeboten durch unsere hauseigene HSO Academy und externe Schulungspartner in Kombination mit einem individuellenKarrierepfad fördern
  • Onboarding@HSO: Wir heißen dich in unserem Office in Böblingen willkommen - du startest deine ersten Onboarding-Tage bei uns vor Ort, um dich mit unserer Unternehmenskultur, unseren Prozessen und Tools vertraut zu machen
  • Hybrid Workforce: Ohne festgeschriebene Kernarbeitszeit hast du die Möglichkeit flexibel bei Kunden vor Ort, aus deinem Homeoffice oder in unseren Offices in Böblingen, München, Nürnberg oder Chemnitz zu arbeiten
  • Appreciation: Ein attraktives Gehaltsmodell inklusive 20 % Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge, Mitarbeiterangebote, Bikeleasing, Gesundheitsförderung durch EGYM Wellpass, Geburtstagsgutscheine und außergewöhnliche Events runden dein HSO-Feel-Good-Paket ab
  • Workation: Wir möchten unseren Mitarbeitenden mehr Flexibilität und Freiräume bieten, damit sie ihre Work-Life-Balance aktiv gestalten können. Daher hast du die Möglichkeit, bis zu 30 Tage im Jahr unter Einhaltung der rechtlichen Bedingungen aus der EU, dem EWR und der Schweiz zu arbeiten


HSO fördert aktiv Vielfalt und Inklusion. Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen qualifizierten Personen - unabhängig von ethnischer Herkunft, Hautfarbe, Religion, Geschlecht, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlechtsidentität, nationaler Herkunft, Behinderung oder Alter. Wir setzen uns für ein diskriminierungsfreies Arbeitsumfeld ein, in dem Chancengleichheit gefördert und die Unterschiedlichkeit jedes Einzelnen respektiert und wertgeschätzt wird.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
About

Stellen-ID: 1544

Du hast Lust, Pionierarbeit zu leisten und Strukturen von Grund auf mitzugestalten? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig! Bei uns baust Du die Brücke zwischen Marketing, Sales, Controlling und dem Data & AI Hub.

Die Thieme Gruppe ist marktführender Anbieter von Informationen und Services, die dazu beitragen, Gesundheit und Gesundheitsversorgung zu verbessern. Mit digitalen Lösungsangeboten in Medizin und Chemie unterstützt Thieme Informations- und Kommunikationsprozesse in Wissenschaft, Aus-, Fort- und Weiterbildung sowie in der Patientenversorgung. Gemeinsam mit einem breiten Experten- und Partnernetzwerk stellt der digitale Gesundheitsdienstleister sicher, medizinisch-wissenschaftlich, aber auch didaktisch-technologisch Taktgeber zu sein. Die weltweit tätigen über 1000 Mitarbeitenden des Familienunternehmens setzen sich mit innovativen Neu- und Weiterentwicklungen tagtäglich für eine bessere Medizin und mehr Gesundheit im Leben ein.

Bereich: Marketing

Start: zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt

Vertragsdauer: unbefristet

Arbeitszeit: Vollzeit (38h/Woche)


Du übernimmst eine zentrale Rolle beim Aufbau von Reporting-Strukturen für das Marketing, indem du die Konzeption und Einführung standardisierter und zunehmend automatisierter Reportings verantwortest.
Mit dem Ziel, datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen, entwickelst du eigenverantwortlich aussagekräftige Reports und Analysen in Power BI und nutzt SQL-Abfragen, um Daten gezielt aufzubereiten.
Du baust eine Basis an Umsatzberichten auf, die speziell auf die Bedürfnisse des Marketings ausgerichtet sind, insbesondere Umsätze nach Märkten und Vertriebskanälen und recurring revenue aus unseren Lizenz- und Aboprodukten.
Als Expert*in für Marketing und Sales Funnel Analytics entwickelst du Analysen entlang der Customer Journey (Awareness, Engagement, Trial, Buy, Churn) und trägst dazu bei, unsere Conversion Rates und operativen KPIs transparent zu machen.
Du nutzt verschiedene Datenquellen wie unser CRM-System, Google Analytics und weitere Datenbanken, um ein ganzheitliches Bild der Marketing-Performance zu erstellen.
Perspektivisch gestaltest du außerdem Predictive-Analytics-Modelle mit, die es uns ermöglichen, frühzeitig auf Abwanderungstendenzen zu reagieren und langfristige Kundenbeziehungen zu sichern.
Abgeschlossene Ausbildung oder Studium im Bereich Data, Controlling, Marketing oder Wirtschaft
Erfahrung im Marketing- oder Sales-Controlling
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Power BI
Solide SQL-Kenntnisse
Sehr sicherer Umgang mit Excel und Interesse an datenbankgestützten Lösungen
Ausgezeichnetes analytisches Denkvermögen und eine strukturierte, lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise
Freude daran, neue Strukturen aufzubauen und Verantwortung zu übernehmenErfahrung in Funnel-, Customer Journey- und Churn-Analysen
Fließende Englischkenntnisse
Durch die Möglichkeit zur Gleitzeit (38h/Woche bei Vollzeit) und zum mobilen Arbeiten innerhalb Deutschlands, gestaltest du deine individuelle Arbeitsweise.
Nutze modernste Hardware, die wir dir selbstverständlich zur Verfügung stellen.
Ein familiengeführtes, international agierendes Unternehmen - Sei Teil unserer digitalen Transformation und gestalte die Zukunft im Gesundheitswesen aktiv mit.
Begleite zukunftsweisende Innovationen im Bereich der Digitalisierung und setze gemeinsam mit uns neue Maßstäbe.
Erlebe eine New Work Kultur der Partizipation - bei uns stehen Empowerment und der wertschätzende Umgang miteinander im Mittelpunkt.
Profitiere von individuellen Angeboten der Thieme.ACADEMY, die deine Stärken fördern und deine persönliche Entwicklung vorantreiben.
Profitiere von diversen Gesundheits- und Sportangeboten.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




Do you want to design cutting-edge AI and ML solutions, work with advanced data models, and empower businesses with innovative analytics?




Nexer Insight is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg. We invite you to embark on an exciting journey where you'll work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. At Nexer Insight, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions for our clients.




Nexer Insight

Nexer Insight is a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. As a Data Scientist with us, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, including LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and advanced AI solutions. We value teamwork, professional growth, and a vibrant community spirit. With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with experts in the field, and make a meaningful impact in the intersection of data science and AI.




Key Responsibilities

Develop advanced AI/ML models and design solutions leveraging LLMs for various AI use cases, including RAG and intelligent agents.
Apply machine learning, statistical methods, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
Build and deploy data pipelines and cloud-based architectures for ML workloads and MLOps.
Innovate and collaborate with clients to discover new business opportunities and develop tailored solutions.
Work with NLP, computer vision, and containerized applications to deliver high-impact projects.
Leverage platforms like Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, and Azure ML for scalable and efficient workflows.
Promote best practices for data science, from architecture and data quality to reliability and performance.




Who You Are

We expect you to have:

Minimum 4 years within Data Science
Strong understanding of LLMs and experience building solutions on top of them for AI-driven solutions.
Experience with RAG and AI-driven agents.
An analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
Problem-solving aptitude and a proactive mindset.
Hands-on experience with applied ML, statistics, and cloud architectures for MLOps.
Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and familiarity with tools like Databricks.
Knowledge of computer vision, NLP, SQL, and containerized apps.
Experience with Azure cloud services such as Azure ML and Azure Data Lake.
Fluency in Swedish and English.




Why Nexer Insight?

At Nexer Insight, we invest in our employees by providing professional development, certifications, and a vibrant working culture. With us, you'll be part of a team pushing boundaries and using advanced data science to create meaningful solutions for leading clients.




Are you ready to take the next step in your career and explore the forefront of AI and data science? Apply today and join us on this exciting journey!

Title: Utredare
Company: CAN - Centralförbundet för alkohol- och narkotikaupplysning
Description:
Utredare med kvantitativ inriktning

Vill du arbeta med viktiga samhällsfrågor i ett sammanhang där ditt analysarbete gör skillnad? Vi söker nu en utredare med erfarenhet av kvantitativ metod till CAN:s avdelning Utredning & Forskning.

Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse

Varaktighet: Tillsvidareanställning, 100 %, med provanställning i 6 månader.

Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-15

Ansök: Utredare med kvantitativ inriktning - CAN




Om CAN

CAN är ett nationellt kompetenscentrum som genomför flera omfattande befolkningsundersökningar inom ANDTS-området. Våra större undersökningar omfattar bland annat CAN:s nationella skolundersökning, Vanor och konsekvenser samt Monitormätningarna. Vår kunskap används av myndigheter, forskare och organisationer i hela Sverige. Vi är 22 medarbetare som arbetar i ljusa lokaler på Östgötagatan vid Skanstull i Stockholm.




Om tjänsten

Som utredare hos oss medverkar du i hela kedjan av CAN:s kvantitativa undersökningar – från planering och datainsamling till analys och rapportering. Arbetet är varierande och sker ofta i nära samarbete med kollegor inom och utanför avdelningen. Vi är en liten arbetsplats där vi hjälps åt, och du kommer därför också att bidra med din kompetens i andra delar av verksamheten vid behov.




Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:




Ansvara för statistisk bearbetning och analys av datamängder
Författa och sammanställa olika typer av publikationer
Delta i projektgrupper och samarbeta tvärfunktionellt inom organisationen
Hålla muntliga presentationer av resultat för olika målgrupper
Medverka i planering och genomförande av CAN:s kvantitativa undersökningar




Kvalifikationer

Krav:

Akademisk examen inom ett samhällsvetenskapligt ämne med kvantitativ inriktning (exempelvis sociologi, folkhälsovetenskap, kriminologi, statistik eller motsvarande)
Goda kunskaper i SPSS, SAS, STATA eller liknande analysverktyg
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av liknande utredningsarbete
Erfarenhet av att analysera data inom ramen för kvantitativa undersökningar
God förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska i tal och skrift, samt att strukturera, anpassa och förmedla innehåll till olika målgrupper
Grundläggande läsförståelse av vetenskapliga artiklar och instruktioner på engelska

Meriterande:

Kunskap om ANDTS-området
Erfarenhet från folkhälsoområdet
Erfarenhet av att utforma undersökningsupplägg och metoder
Erfarenhet av hur AI kan användas i analysarbete




Personliga egenskaper

Vi söker dig som är:

Analytisk – Du bearbetar och analyserar statistiska datamängder metodiskt och kritiskt
Strukturerad och självständig – Du planerar och genomför ditt arbete med stor noggrannhet och driver projekt framåt inom givna tidsramar
Kommunikativ – Du är trygg med att hålla muntliga presentationer och anpassa budskap till olika målgrupper
Samarbetsinriktad – Du trivs med att arbeta i grupp och bidra till gemensamma mål
Prestigelös – Du är öppen för att testa nya arbetssätt och ser lärande som en naturlig del av arbetet




Vi erbjuder:




Ett meningsfullt arbete i en samhällsnyttig organisation
Flexibilitet med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till 49 % av veckoarbetstiden, beroende på arbetsuppgifternas natur och när arbetet tillåter.
Friskvårdsbidrag samt 90 minuter friskvårdstid per vecka
Arbetstidsförkortning och sommararbetstid
Utökade semesterdagar och möjlighet att semesterväxla
Kollektivavtal
En inkluderande arbetsmiljö där hälsa och välmående prioriteras




Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse.

Varaktighet: Tillsvidareanställning, 100 %, med provanställning i 6 månader.

Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-15

Vi har valt att ta bort det personliga brevet ur rekryteringsprocessen. I stället ansöker du med ditt CV och genom att besvara urvalsfrågor.

Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Ta därför chansen och sök redan idag!




Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

För ytterligare information kontakta Ulf Guttormsson, avdelningschef (0723-71 43 19). Fackliga representanter är Johan Svensson (SACO, 0723-71 43 51) och Ida Ömalm Ronvall (Unionen, 0723-71 43 25).

Job Description:

We are Merkle Sweden - part of Merkle Northern Europe. Merkle is a leader in data-driven customer experience management (CXM), and we help the world's best brands deliver unique, personalized customer experiences across channels and devices. We provide expertise in digital analytics, customer experience strategy and consulting, user experience design, CRM, data management, commerce, content management systems (CMS), ad tech and martech. We are part of Merkle Worldwide and dentsu – a global agency network covering 145 markets.

Our Swedish Data & Analytics team is now looking for a Data & Analytics Consultant to join our journey and help us grow.

Merkle is looking for a driven specialist with a huge interest in data and analytics. You’ll be based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm. You may also work from a distance.


Implement metrics for clients and provide regular analysis.
Give recommendations for measurement solutions for digital services based on clients’ business and activity goals.
Maintain and develop a strong know-how of Google Marketing Platform in general and Google Analytics 360 in particular. Other measurement tools may be used.
Provide insights and recommendations that improve clients’ activities and business.
Develop data-visualization solutions (in dashboards) that make it possible for clients to follow sales and other important performance indicators in real time.



Qualifications


Experience working with large amounts of data and an understanding of SQL and databases.
In-depth knowledge of working with Google Analytics data, being an advanced user.
An eye for details, logical thinking, and good problem-solving skills.
Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.
Used to presenting to both large and small groups of varying degrees of knowledge, internally within the Group and also with clients.
Good self-management skills and a positive attitude toward change.
Ability to manage different work tasks and projects and prioritize accordingly as you will be working with several clients and projects at the same time.
Ability to work with data analysis and provide accurate recommendations based on data.



Knowledge of data-visualization tools, formal statistics training, and experience with Google Cloud (especially BigQuery) are desirable.

Additional information

Our extensive experience and deep proficiency in Google Analytics 360 and Google Optimize mean that our clients rely on us for their most complex, challenging assignments. Our finances are stable (AAA), and we have a collective agreement and attractive benefits. Several years in a row, we have won the DI Gasell Award, won the Mästargasellen Award, and been named a “Superföretag” (Super Company) by Veckans Affärer and Bisnode.

Some of the Perks We Offer:


Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
Possibility to work with multinational companies in a number of different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
Continuous personal development in the form of lab days, groups exchanging experiences, and your own professional development budget.
Working from an office by Skrapan on Södermalm, Stockholm, or by Nordstan in Gothenburg.
The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle Outfox/Northern Europe is a part of.



Is your heart racing a little now? If you can see yourself in all this – both the job and being part of Merkle – we would love to hear from you.

Please send us your CV.

There is no application deadline, finding the right candidate is more important to us than a speedy process. We remove the job-ad when filling the position.

Title: Freelance Data Analyst (Python) - AI Trainer
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Data Analysis, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Triple-check some delivery data and ensure client expectations are reflected in every batch
Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge
Ensure taxonomies are logical, consistent, and aligned with operational needs



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Mathematics
You have at least 3 years of professional experience in Data Analysis
You have experience with prompt engineering (basic to intermediate level) and have Basic-to-Intermediate Python Scripting and SQL understanding
You are proficient in spreadsheet tools such as Google Sheets, Excel
You have experience with interpreting data visualization & reporting (e.g., dashboards)
You have a strong command of taxonomy and classification design
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: Senior Analytics Consultant
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com

Job Description

We are looking for a dynamic Senior Analytics Consultant to join our Northern Europe analytics team, specializing in credit risk management with a strong focus on client engagement and innovative solutions. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in the banking and finance sector or management consulting, with a deep understanding of credit risk management and EU/local regulations such as IRB, IFRS 9, NPL management and ESG standards.

You will be responsible for building and maintaining client relationships, leading and managing analytics projects, and delivering analytics solutions to the benefit of our clients and their customers. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and SQL is preferred, along with excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex information clearly. You will also play a key role in developing new scores and attributes, new analytics products and use cases of analytics platforms, staying updated on industry trends. If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and have a keen interest in fintech development, we would love to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Build client relationships, and identify and drive client opportunities, being a trusted advisor for our clients.
Participate in pre-sales and sales meetings with clients and prospects to describe and position Experian's analytics projects, determine the client requirements across the full range of Experian Decision Analytics solutions ensuring the relationship with the client is productive and professional.
Engage in a consultative way with the clients to identify problems and define, design and deliver solutions and identify new opportunities. Create and present proposals and recommendations to clients for solutions.
Lead and manage project teams, ensure successful delivery of analytics projects, delivery of value-driven recommendations, knowledge transfer and effective advisory.
Lead innovation analytics driven projects, playing an active role in developing new analytics products and solutions for our clients.
Act as a Project Manager for projects involving statistical modelling, analytics platforms, sandbox use or regulatory analytics, assessing project scope, duration, resources and cost to define the project plan.
Review the project deliveries to ensure that all analysis is thorough and established, quality procedures are followed to help guarantee the robustness of the solution and that all critical business issues are identified through data analysis.
Stay on top of industry trends and engage and collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Sales, Pre-Sales, Product, Operations, Data and Platforms as well as international teams to ensure scaling Experian Analytics presence & capabilities across financial services.
Lead workshops and knowledge sharing sessions with our clients, joining Experian events as a speaker to provide expertise and insights to our clients.
Analyze and identify value creation and improvement opportunities at the intersection of business, data and technology.
Mentor and coach junior colleagues in the team.


Qualifications


Master’s degree in quantitative fields such as Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Business Science, Economics, Management or a related field.
4 to 8 years of proven experience in credit risk management within the banking and finance sector or in any management consulting or analytics and data driven industry.
Strong understanding of credit risk management and analytics areas. Knowhow with EU and local credit risk regulations, including IRB, IFRS 9, NPL Management and ESG standards.
Strong understanding of analytical products, data and analytics. Proficiency in Python, PySpark, SQL and Databricks knowledge is a plus and familiarity with advanced analytics techniques and tools such as machine learning and AI.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex information clearly to clients and bridge the gap between technical and non-technical teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to analyze large datasets and develop predictive models, innovative thinking and the ability to translate data and analytics into business outcomes.
In-depth knowledge of market trends, financial products including strong market knowledge and experience in the Nordic financial sector.
Experience in managing projects and leading teams.
Fluency in Danish or Norwegian and English is a must.


What we offer?


Great compensation package and bonus plan.
Core benefits including health insurance, Experian shares discount, pension and wellbeing benefits.
Flexible work environment, hybrid work.
Flexible work hours including volunteer time off and 6 weeks holidays.


Additional Information

Proud to be a Worlds Best Workplace 2024

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are main differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what truly matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; Great Place To Work™ in 24 countries, FORTUNE Best Companies to work and Glassdoor Best Places to Work (globally 4.4 Stars) to name a few. Data Analyst / Statistician (Category II)

Conduct variance analysis and support cost-benefit and cost-effectiveness assessments.

Develop compelling data visualizations, dashboards, and presentations for technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborate with finance, education, and policy experts to support integrated analytical outputs.
Contribute to the design and implementation of data collection strategies where needed.
Prepare analytical reports, briefs, and data summaries for stakeholders and decision-makers.

Advanced proficiency in statistical software and data visualization tools (e.g., R, Python, STATA, SPSS, Tableau, Power BI).
Proven experience in handling large datasets and applying advanced statistical techniques.
Strong knowledge of public sector data, fiscal indicators, or development finance is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to present complex data in accessible formats.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A leading student accommodation company is seeking a dynamic and motivated Data Analyst to support key business functions across revenue management, marketing, sales, and commercial strategy. This role offers an exciting opportunity for an analytically-minded professional to work cross-functionally, delivering data-driven insights that inform strategic decisions and drive performance across the organisation.

Reporting to the Head of Sales and working closely with the business systems team, the successful candidate will bring a strong analytical mindset, solid technical skills, and ideally, experience within the purpose-built student accommodation (PBSA) or wider property sector.

Key Responsibilities

Market Intelligence
Collects and analyses market data on rental levels, occupancy rates, and sector trends within the PBSA market and related areas such as Build-to-Rent (BTR) and Houses in Multiple Occupation (HMO).
Conducts market and competitor analysis to inform pricing strategies and revenue planning.

Data Analysis

Supports pricing decisions by modelling demand scenarios, benchmarking competitors, and identifying seasonal trends.
Forecasts rental revenue, uncovers growth opportunities, and supports the development of leasing strategies.
Works with the sales team to refine rental proposals and optimise rent-setting approaches.
Monitors KPIs, highlights data anomalies, and recommends appropriate actions.
Assists in analysing data during the migration from legacy systems to new property management platforms.

Reporting

Prepares accommodation schedules based on floor plans, operational data, and stakeholder requirements.
Contributes to budgeting, forecasting, and scenario modelling activities using Excel and other financial tools.
Designs and maintains dashboards, reports, and data visualisations using tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Oversees system performance post-migration to ensure the consistency and quality of data.

Data Management

Maintains and ensures the accuracy of internal and external data sources.
Collaborates with multiple departments to align data insights with business goals.
Uses SQL, Python, or R to extract, manipulate, and analyse data from various systems.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Royal Leamington Spa, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Meta Reality Lab’s mission is to help people feel connected, anytime, anywhere. Pushing the boundaries of what is technically possible in virtual worlds is a critical part of this mission. As a Data Analyst you’ll be working with a talented group of industry professionals and helping to drive strategic development in this emergent and creative space. If you’re excited about forging into new territory and pushing the boundaries of real-time experience building across a variety of products, this is the place for you.

Data Analyst Responsibilities:


Guide Development and Growth: Work with partner teams to capture new feature requirements, generate success criteria, establish and implement measurement plans and experiments, and create reporting solutions that help to evaluate success and guide subsequent development
Communicate Insights Effectively: Utilise data visualisation and storytelling techniques to clearly communicate outcomes and insights to technical and non-technical audiences
Collaborate and Partner: Work collaboratively with stakeholders, including engineering, research, and forecasting analytics, to execute best practices in data gathering and analytics
Develop Self-Service Reports: Build and automate easy-to-use, self-service reports and dashboards, and maintain code-base (SQL) used to drive self-service tools
Maintain Data Integrity: Audit data integrity, investigate concerns, and partner with data engineer teams to prioritise resolutions
Provide Direction and Coaching: Offer guidance and coaching to end-users on how to use and interpret metrics, and deliver standard reports/dashboards on a regular cadence


Minimum Qualifications:


3+ years of experience in a strategic analytics development role
Experience managing and analyzing structured and unstructured data using tools such as SQL, Alteryx, and Tableau
Understanding of data visualization principles
Experience with survey analysis, data management, and understanding of data structures
Experience handling sensitive data, and exercising judgment and discretion
Experience managing stakeholder requirements and expectations, supporting needs, managing the intake process, and asking questions to scope and solve the requests
Experience communicating technical results to technical and non-technical audiences across all levels of an organization
Experience navigating a fast-paced, dynamic working environment
Experience with measurement strategies, analytics, change management, design-thinking, program and project management


Preferred Qualifications:


BS/MS in a field that emphasizes data analysis and visualization (e.g., computer science, social sciences, physical sciences, math, engineering, or statistics), or equivalent work experience
Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams, including product owners and solution architects, to drive business outcomes through data-driven insights
Experience tackling complex talent development and organizational effectiveness challenges using data analytics
Experience designing and implementing data-driven solutions, conducting research, and applying best practices to drive business impact
Experience applying analytics and A/B test experiments to inform strategy and tactical feature and content development


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital Asset
Description:
Data Analyst




We’re hiring a Senior Data Analyst to support the growth of a global data and index provider in the digital assets space - delivering trusted, high-impact insights for clients, partners, and internal teams.




This is a hands-on, insight-led role, focused on making complex datasets meaningful across product, engineering, and commercial functions. You'll play a key role in defining performance metrics, automating anomaly detection, and telling the story behind the numbers.




What you’ll be doing:

Analysing data products and supporting wider teams with actionable insight
Building QA metrics, KPIs, and automated anomaly detection tools
Supporting product teams with success metrics and ongoing data refinement
Visualising insights through dashboards and reports
Collaborating cross-functionally with engineering, product, and commercial teams




What we’re looking for:

2+ years' experience in data analysis or data science (financial data preferred)
Proficient in Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, etc.)
Experience with APIs (REST/WebSocket) and time series datasets
Strong communicator, comfortable translating complex data for non-technical stakeholders
Self-starter, curious mindset, and thrives in fast-paced, agile teams




What you get:

Salary £50,000–£60,000 basic (DOE) + 15% bonus
Hybrid working environment
High-impact role in a globally recognised digital data business
Work with cutting-edge technologies and teams




If you love diving into data, solving meaningful problems, and want to shape the future of digital markets - we’d love to hear from you.




Apply now or message Oliver for more info.
